alert.note: Alert for Morris (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 29 at 8:28PM CDT until April 29 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL MORRIS COUNTY... At 828 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near White City and one mile west of Parkerville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Dwight and Parkerville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
